1.content:
"You load sixteen tons, and what do you get?
Another day older and deeper in debt
St. Peter, don't you call me, 'cause I can't go
I owe my soul to the company store."

That was the song you sang on your way to the station and then probably to your steam engine that you nicknamed "Puff." It has been like this for about several years when you went to work for the train company two years ago when you were sixteen and had another choice other than coal mines or going hungry.

About this time you run into your partner Scorch, his red scaled body towering over yours a good head.
"You always sing that blasted song" Scorch said "why don't you sing something else?"
You look up at Scorch and said "it reminds me of my old job, and how this job is a whole lot better than it."

Scorch gave a sigh before entering the door of the station and grabbing his punch card. "Another morning, another load, and another day added to my life" Scorch mumbled as he stuck it into the machine. You following suit right after him.

That was when you feasted your eyes on something that you haven't seen before.
In the station was a giant black beast of a locomotive, coal black to be more exact. It was a 4-8-8-4 (four leading wheels, two sets of eight powered wheels, and a trailing set of four wheels) and probably something that you couldn't possibly fathom going against. On the coal car the words "Visons of Mahler." Your friend Scorch probably had the same opinion as his long tung hung out limply from his open jaw.

"I take it that you like our new employie'sssss locomotive" came a silky smooth voice of a female naga slithering up behind them.
"Mrs. Tipany!" Scorch jumped into attention.
Mrs. Tipany, your boss, pointed at a very tall human, about seven foot tall, wearing a black cloak with long white hair and a thin face that looked like it had endured many years of hard work and pain without getting a single wrinkle.

"That's our new employee, Mr. Viost Von Ripenstoosh," Tipany introduced "but he prefers to be called Vio though."

You didn't rea;ly like him at first, there was somthing not... right about him. Like a constant feeling of being watched and haunted.
"Make shure you get along" Tipany said "because he is very essential as our loads are getting bigger and heaver."

You had a hard time seeing yourself calmly having a conversation with the man, there wasn't anything wrong, but you couldnt get settled.

11.content:
No matter how much you wanted to gawk at the massive black machine you had to get too work.

Your train "Puff" was quite uninteresting, being a little green 2-6-4 with a little cow catcher and stubby smoke stack. No how small it was though it was a two man job to work, you, being the smarter of the two, was the overall operator and handled the gauges while Scorch handeled the hard labor like working with the firebox.

Each and every day you did much of the same thing, deliver raw cotton to the factory on the other side of town, then you delivered the mail to a town really close by, and then some other random jobs that can all be summed up as a "fetch quest."

Today on the other hand, your train had an extra box car to the load that had the words "Clockwork Shipping" painted on the side. You could swear that you heard ticking inside but you shrug it off as you check the clipboard. The destination of the box car was...
11.title: Owe My Soul

112.content:
"No wonder there were fewer jobs on our schedual" you said to yourself as you read the specifications on the boxcar, "this thing is supposed to go to Claxton, that's about an hour's ride from here."
"Well, let's get this baby delivered then" Scorch told you as he loaded a few spades of coal into the firebox "the quicker this thing is delivered the sooner we get to go home."

The two of you then got "Puff" all steamed up and chugging towards Claxton. The town of Claxton was actualy less of a town and more of plot of land covered in abandond homes and buisnesses that looke like new while everything else was dead. This is what happens when the government tries to make a town without testing the toxins in the ground and local well.

"Kind of strange isn't it" you asked to no one in particular.
"What do you mean?" Scorch asked

12.content:
You sat down on one of the benches and opened up your metal lunch box.
"Didn't eat breakfast Whick?" Scorch asked sitting down next to you.
You shook your head no before biting into a small strip of warm bacon.

"RUNAWAY TRAIN!" Yelled a man as he got off the telegraph line. Everyone looked down the track to see a large cloud of black smoke coming from a train that was some distance away. You notice that even Vio was watching it with great intrest before hopping in his train "Mahler" and started it up.

Something was up as the runaway train in question was actualy blowing it's whistle, giving out a haunting howl.
"Is it me" Scorch asked as he squinted his eyes to get a better look of the train in question "but does that locomotive have teeth?"
Sure enough, the front of the train had curved metal fangs as it's exterior dripped with a grey slime. The boiler of the 4-10-2 looked like it had ribs while the cab glowed with a red light.

That was when you saw "Mahler" start to leave the station, Vio was going after the train.

info.brief_description: Working on the railroad and it's getting old.  Untill life throws you a curve ball.
info.description:
You are an eighteen year old train engineer in a world stuck in the industrial revolution. Steam was king in these times but it didn't pay the best, only enough to keep your family alive.
Whick was the nickname you were given when you were hired (mostly because of the permenent cowlick in your black hair) and at the moment it's the only name that matters. Your body has grown some muscle working on the rail road, your skin worn and covered in both ashes and burn marks. Wearing a pair of goggles is the only protection for your eyes as you work the valves while your red dragon friend Scorch, who was about your age, fuels the firebox with coal.

No slash please
No porn
Fighting is encouraged as long as it dosn't get gory
No "OMG ALIENS THEN UBDUCTED THEM" like posts, but mild strange phenomena are alowed and later on maybe some magic.
Please add to the story and enjoy.
